 
Akash used to be a good student till class 12. In the last semester he was asked a simple question by our own MS. The question was not tough but not easy too. Given a number  N and a number M you need to calculate  N! % M. Akash thought it was too easy and so started smiling. Realising that it is too easy he gave akash some large values and promised to give him an O in the Lab exam. Help him get an O.
 

Input
The first line of input contains an integer T, denoting the number of test cases. Then T test cases follow.

Each test case contains two integers N and M separated by a space. 

 

Output

For each test case, output a single line containing the value N!% M.

 

Constraints and Example
Input:
4
5 7
13 19
20 483
35 2

Output:
1
16
126
0

 

Explanation
Example case 1. 5!=(120)%7 is 1
